description: Fungi foray images from November 2014, recorded by Ray Tantram

images.suggested_alt_text: Tiny greyish fairy bonnet mushrooms clustered on rotting wood
images.suggested_caption: Fairy Bonnets (Coprinellus disseminatus) - tiny mushrooms in clumps on rotting stumps

images.suggested_alt_text: Cluster of tan-colored mushrooms on forest floor
images.suggested_caption: Unidentified fungus - image too indistinct for field identification
images.review_reason: Noted as 'too indistinct to differentiate' in foray report

images.suggested_alt_text: Two pear-shaped puffball fungi held in hand showing tan coloration
images.suggested_caption: Pear-shaped Puffball (Lycoperdon pyriforme) - grows on wood with branched mycelial cords at base

images.suggested_alt_text: Cross-section of black King Alfred's cakes fungus showing concentric rings
images.suggested_caption: King Alfred's Cakes (Daldinia concentrica) - mature specimen, hard crumbly black balls on dead ash

images.suggested_alt_text: Young brown King Alfred's cakes fungi on mossy log
images.suggested_caption: King Alfred's Cakes (Daldinia concentrica) - young material, brown color, works as tinder

images.suggested_alt_text: Cluster of white pear-shaped puffball mushrooms growing on dead wood
images.suggested_caption: Pear-shaped Puffball (Lycoperdon pyriforme) - tan puffballs growing in cluster on wood

images.suggested_alt_text: Large shaggy parasol mushroom held in hands showing white cap and gills
images.suggested_caption: Shaggy Parasol (Chlorophyllum rhacodes) - grows under trees, flesh reddens when cut, edible but can cause digestive upset in some people

images.suggested_alt_text: Tiny white mushroom with primitive decurrent gills held in hand
images.suggested_caption: Delicatula integrella - tiny white mushrooms with primitive decurrent gills, found in damp areas near willow and alder

images.suggested_alt_text: White mushroom with yellow staining at stem base showing characteristic yellowing
images.suggested_caption: Yellow Staining Mushroom (Agaricus xanthodermus) - POISONOUS - stains bright yellow when scratched, carbolic smell especially when cooking

images.suggested_alt_text: Mass of white clustered mushrooms on fallen tree trunk
images.suggested_caption: Unidentified fungus - image too indistinct for field identification
images.review_reason: Noted as 'too indistinct to differentiate' in foray report

images.suggested_alt_text: Pink-lilac jelly-like fungi growing on fallen beech wood
images.suggested_caption: Neobulgaria pura - pale pink-lilac crowded jelly buttons on fallen beech

images.suggested_alt_text: Small yellow-orange jelly spots on bare fallen timber
images.suggested_caption: Jelly Spot (Dacrymyces stillatus) - small yellow to orange gelatinous blobs on barkless fallen timber

images.suggested_alt_text: Creamy-brown shell-shaped fungi growing on fallen beech trunk
images.suggested_caption: Peeling Oysterling (Crepidotus mollis) - soft creamy-brown 'shells' on dead wood, elastic cap skin peels off

images.suggested_alt_text: Orange-brown bracket fungi and white mushrooms on rotting stump
images.suggested_caption: Unidentified fungi - image too indistinct for field identification
images.review_reason: Noted as 'too indistinct to differentiate' in foray report

images.suggested_alt_text: Small tan mushroom caps with glistening particles in tufts on wood
images.suggested_caption: Glistening Inkcap (Coprinellus micaceus) - small tan caps with glistening particles, growing in tufts on wood

images.suggested_alt_text: Thin overlapping bracket fungi growing in tiers on dead wood
images.suggested_caption: Turkey Tails (Trametes versicolor) - old specimen lacking bright color bands, grows in tiers on dead wood

images.suggested_alt_text: Pink-rose-brown mushrooms with distinctive gill pattern
images.suggested_caption: Deceiver (Laccaria laccata) - pinky-rose-brown mushrooms with three different gill lengths, very variable in appearance

images.suggested_alt_text: Cluster of tan glistening inkcap mushrooms growing from mossy stump
images.suggested_caption: Glistening Inkcap (Coprinellus micaceus) - small tan caps with glistening particles, in tufts on wood

images.suggested_alt_text: Lower surface of Artist's fungus showing white pores and layered tubes
images.suggested_caption: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - lower surface showing pore layer, tubes in distinct layers

images.suggested_alt_text: Upper surface of old Artist's fungus bracket showing brown coloration with moss
images.suggested_caption: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - upper surface of old specimen, brown thick bracket

images.suggested_alt_text: Fresh white puffballs with characteristic pearly texture in leaf litter
images.suggested_caption: Puffball (Lycoperdon perlatum) - fresh specimens with small 'pearls' that rub off, grows in leaf litter, edible

images.suggested_alt_text: Blurred pink-lilac mushroom specimen being handled
images.suggested_caption: Lilac Mycena (Mycena pura) - medium-sized pink to lilac cap, smell of radish, found in beech litter, POISONOUS
images.review_reason: Image is blurred and out of focus, may not be suitable for publication

images.suggested_alt_text: Bright yellow sulphur tuft mushrooms growing in profusion on stump
images.suggested_caption: Sulphur Tuft (Hypholoma fasciculare) - grows on stumps in profusion, sulphur-colored gills darken as spores mature, POISONOUS

images.suggested_alt_text: Golden-brown mushrooms growing in cluster on tree stump
images.suggested_caption: Kuehneromyces mutabilis - golden-brown viscous caps growing in tufts on stumps, in poor condition, can be confused with poisonous species
images.review_reason: Noted as 'in poor condition' in foray report

images.suggested_alt_text: Large brown bracket fungus showing upper surface with concentric zones
images.suggested_caption: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - upper surface of large specimen, brown thick bracket on broadleaf wood

images.suggested_alt_text: Close-up of pale pink-lilac jelly fungi with small dark insects
images.suggested_caption: Neobulgaria pura - close-up showing pale pink-lilac jelly buttons on fallen beech, with insect visitors

images.suggested_alt_text: Extreme close-up of tiny white fairy bonnet mushrooms showing delicate cap structure
images.suggested_caption: Fairy Bonnets (Coprinellus disseminatus) - close-up showing tiny greyish caps with delicate structure

images.suggested_alt_text: White waxy encrusting fungus growing over moss on decayed fallen tree
images.suggested_caption: Sebacina incrustans - encrusting resupinate fungus forming creamy patches over moss on decayed broadleaf tree, waxy texture

images.suggested_alt_text: Lower surface of Artist's fungus showing pores with exit holes from gall fly larvae
images.suggested_caption: Artist's Fungus (Ganoderma applanatum) - lower surface showing pores with numerous exit holes of fungus gall fly larvae

species_identified.edibility: Edible (can cause digestive upset in some)
Not recommended (can be confused with poisonous species)

notable_specimens.reason: Large, clear specimen of Shaggy Parasol showing diagnostic features
Fresh puffball specimens in excellent condition, as noted by recorder
Shows rare fungus gall fly larvae exit holes in Artist's fungus

metadata.conservation_notes: This foray documented 45 species total (only 29 photographed). Represents healthy fungal diversity in mature woodland habitat at Farthing Downs.
metadata.additional_species_list: Full species list includes 45 species found during the foray. Complete list available in original HTML document (Fungi-011114.html) with detailed descriptions by Ray Tantram.
